DOC.brief_title: Chest Ultrasound ER Patients With Cough SOB
DOC.detailed_description: Acute dyspnea ( shortness breath ) common complaint patient present Emergency Department ( ED ) . The chest radiograph ( CXR ) mainstay evaluate patient shortness breath often provide timely diagnosis pneumonia , pneumothorax , pulmonary edema , among primary disease lung . There limitation chest radiograph large body mass ( e.g , obesity ) patient position . On occasion , chest radiography finding difficult interpret . Lung ultrasonography may offer mean clarify ambiguous result . Advantages ultrasound include real-time immediate evaluation , non-invasive use radiation . The investigator seek perform prospective evaluation patient present University Washington Medical Center ED cough , wheeze and/or shortness breath . The objective study determine usefulness point care lung ultrasound evaluate patient present ED shortness breath , cough and/or wheezing . The specific aim study define utility point-of-care ultrasound evaluation emergency department patient present cough , wheeze and/or shortness breath . The investigator compare ultrasound result radiograph tomography result available , physicians initial impression .
DOC.criteria: Presenting Emergency Department cough , wheeze and/or dyspnea ( shortness breath ) Referred CXR and/or CT scan Life threaten medical condition require immediate treatment Unable sit chest ultrasound Unable consent Pregnant Unable speak , read write English
